scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
dal, pound, poise, van, do, tic, cent, gling, mes, swatch, min, dou, va, tive, moat, proac, con, out, bling, run, les, adopt

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — A domestic dispute, whether verbal or violent.
B. (2 syllables) — A piece of outlying grazing land on an arable farm.[https://www.dsl.ac.uk/entry/snd/[masked] ''[masked]''] Scottish National Dictionary
C. (2 syllables) — someone who willfully destroys or defaces property
D. (2 syllables) — The act of turning around, or [masked] back.
E. (1 syllables) — To surround with a moat.
F. (1 syllables) — To create a [masked], especially a sample of knitted fabric.
G. (4 syllables) — a person who is recovering from illness
H. (2 syllables) — descriptive of any event or stimulus or process that has an effect on events or stimuli or processes that occur subsequently
I. (2 syllables) — the action of people [masked] and coming into contact

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle
